Articles.Content:
I just bought KSP on kind of a impulse buy, I kept seeing it and it REALLY interested me; my only worry was that I wouldn't be good enough at it to make it interesting, but in the end my love of all things do what you want made me unable to resist such a game (it's why I impulse bought mine craft when it was alpha, cube world as well).

So, I'm about to press play and for the first time play KSP, umm, don't know what else to say...

so yeah, hi all.

p.s. just came back from watching Lego Movie, it. was. AWESOME.

It's a difficult game. You'll fail a lot at first, but then you'll figure out what you did wrong, and move on to failing at farther and more exotic locations. Don't let crashes discourage you. They're part of the fun.

Even if you do bad in career, you can always just go sandbox and mess around until you know how to reach orbit. Once you reach orbit, you're halfway to anywhere. So they say, it's not strictly accurate but for some cases you're actually more than halfway. Anyway, even if you still can't do it, there's a whole host of KSP-based Youtubers (such as the renowned Scott Manley) and the forums here for help. You will not fail at this game unless you can't follow instructions, basically. You'll learn so much by playing it, honestly.
